title: Shopping List Manager
description:
Create a shopping list manager using arrays and array operations.

## Requirements

1. Create a struct `ShoppingList` with an `items` property of type `[String]`
2. Add a method `addItem(_ item: String)` that adds an item if it doesn't already exist
3. Add a method `removeItem(_ item: String) -> Bool` that removes an item and returns true if successful
4. Add a method `hasItem(_ item: String) -> Bool` to check if an item exists
5. Add a computed property `count` that returns the number of items
6. Add a method `sortedItems() -> [String]` that returns items in alphabetical order

## Example Usage

```swift
var list = ShoppingList()
list.addItem("Milk")
list.addItem("Bread")
list.addItem("Eggs")
list.addItem("Milk")  // Already exists, not added

print(list.count)  // 3
print(list.hasItem("Milk"))  // true
print(list.sortedItems())  // ["Bread", "Eggs", "Milk"]

list.removeItem("Bread")  // Returns true
print(list.count)  // 2
```

testCases.assertion: { var l = ShoppingList(); l.addItem("A"); return l.count == 1 }()
{ var l = ShoppingList(); l.addItem("A"); l.addItem("A"); return l.count == 1 }()

testCases.description: removeItem should return true for existing item
testCases.assertion: { var l = ShoppingList(); l.addItem("A"); return l.removeItem("A") == true }()

testCases.description: removeItem should return false for non-existing item
testCases.assertion: { var l = ShoppingList(); return l.removeItem("A") == false }()

testCases.description: hasItem should return true for existing item
testCases.assertion: { var l = ShoppingList(); l.addItem("A"); return l.hasItem("A") == true }()

testCases.description: hasItem should return false for non-existing item
testCases.assertion: { var l = ShoppingList(); return l.hasItem("A") == false }()

testCases.description: sortedItems should return alphabetically sorted array
testCases.assertion: { var l = ShoppingList(); l.addItem("C"); l.addItem("A"); l.addItem("B"); return l.sortedItems() == ["A", "B", "C"] }()

hints: Use items.contains() to check if an item already exists before adding
Use items.firstIndex(of:) to find an item's index for removal
Use items.remove(at:) to remove an item at a specific index
Use items.sorted() to return a sorted copy of the array
